intro: Hibiscus corymbosus, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a deciduous shrub native to China and parts of Southeast Asia. It features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming in summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Hibiscus corymbosus prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
